results.name: Sum of the perfect divisors of n.
comment: Sum of divisors d of n with sigma(d) = 2*d.
Unless an odd perfect number exists, a(n) = 0 whenever n is odd.
If no odd perfect numbers exist: If n is 6 mod 12 then a(n) = 6, if n is 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 10, or 11 mod 12 then a(n) = 0.
The first occurrence of three nonzero values at three consecutive even indices is a(1984) = 496, a(1986) = 6, a(1988) = 28.
A185351 gives the distinct values of this sequence (or numbers in the range of the sum of perfect divisors function) in ascending order. - _Timothy L. Tiffin_, Jul 13 2016
Fixed points: a(n) = n if and only if n is a perfect number (A000396). - _Timothy L. Tiffin_, Jul 14 2016
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(84) = 6+28 = 34 since both 6 and 28 divide 84. - _Timothy L. Tiffin_, Jul 14 2016
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, If[DivisorSigma[1, #] == 2#, #, 0]&]; Array[a, 114] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 18 2015 *)
